definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to pile up/to heap up/a mass/pile/heap/stack/large amount

sentences.english: That is Tim's stack of tin thumbtacks.
sentences.chinese: 那是蒂姆一堆錫制的圖釘。

sentences.english: His headquarters are somewhere in the Everglades, his gang are a mixed-up bunch.
sentences.chinese: 其總部設在某處沼澤地，他的團伙是一個混合了一堆。

sentences.english: The desk was covered with a litter of documents.
sentences.chinese: 書桌上滿滿地放着一堆雜亂的文件。

sentences.english: Then, put lots of links to various websites within the image.
sentences.chinese: 然後，在這個圖片裏放一堆鏈接，連到各種網站去。

sentences.english: On the third flight lay a heap of dead men's heads.
sentences.chinese: 三樓上有一堆死人頭呢。

sentences.english: All these records can add up to a nice stack of paper.
sentences.chinese: 所有的這些備份文件積攢起來便成了厚厚一堆紙。

sentences.english: We were on the ground floor and when I came to I was lying under a pile of rubble.
sentences.chinese: 我們當時都在第一層，我發現我躺在一堆碎石塊下。

sentences.english: Soon the wind had piled the snow into drifts .
sentences.chinese: 不久，風把雪吹積成一堆一堆的。

sentences.english: Soon the wind had piled the snow into drifts .
sentences.chinese: 不久，風把雪吹積成一堆一堆的。

sentences.english: This is a daunting list of challenges.
sentences.chinese: 這是一堆使人畏懼的難題。

sentences.english: This glass dish is very fragile.
A pile of magazines tumbled out when he opened the cupboard.
sentences.chinese: 當他打開櫥櫃時，一堆雜誌掉了出來。

sentences.english: The lattice is a bunch of masses and springs.
sentences.chinese: 晶格可以看成是一堆有質量的彈簧。

sentences.english: Hensley glanced in Jack's direction, spied Bauer's legs sticking out of a pile of wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 漢斯萊望向傑克這邊，在一堆殘骸間發現了他的雙腿。

sentences.english: Sift the gravel and put the larger stones in another pile.
sentences.chinese: 篩出碎石，把大點的石頭堆成一堆。

sentences.english: The children huddled together on a pile of old sacks.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們在一堆舊麻袋上面擠成一團。

definition: to pile up/to heap up/a mass/pile/heap/stack/large amount
everything in disorder (idiom); in a hideous mess/at sixes and sevens
to pile up like a mountain (idiom)/a mountain of (paperwork etc)/a large number of sth
an assortment/a bit of everything/lots of different (skills)
